sentences: Ta helistas sõbrale ja küsis, kas too tuleb kohtumisele.
context: The Estonian verb 'helistada' means to call someone on the telephone. It's used when you intentionally make a phone call to someone, similar to how we use 'call', 'ring', or 'phone' in English. The word can be conjugated into different forms depending on the subject and tense (e.g., helistan - I call, helistas - he/she called).
